definition: to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: West Tian Chang Division requires removal of the former Prime Minister Naoto Kan, the original position.
sentences.chinese: 西田昌司要求首相菅直人撤除前原的职务。

sentences.english: Specifies frames used when an infantry unit is order to "undeploy".
sentences.chinese: 指定当步兵被命令“撤除安排”的帧序列。

sentences.english: Now I understand the word 'redeploy' isn't 'remove.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我已经认识到‘重新部署’并非‘撤除’。

sentences.english: But observers are not expecting the countries’ lucrative customs posts to be dismantled.
sentences.chinese: 但是观察员并不期望各国撤除利润丰厚的关税壁垒。

sentences.english: And we have always been making constructive efforts to denuclearize the Korean Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 我们一直都在为撤除朝鲜半岛的核武器而不懈努力着。

sentences.english: The oculist removed a foreign object from his eye.
sentences.chinese: 眼科大夫从他眼中撤除一个异物。

sentences.english: DNT must always be removed from spinal cord after hemostasis is achieved.
sentences.chinese: DNT在止血完成后必须从脊髓周边撤除。

definition: to cut/to throw out/to depose (from office)/to tear off
to tear down/to demolish/to dismantle/to remove
to remove/to sack/to get rid of/to relieve (sb of their duties)/to free/to lift (an embargo)/to rescind (an agreement)
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
variant of 撤銷|撤销[che4 xiao1]
to destroy (by melting or burning)/to obliterate
to clear away/to eliminate/to get rid of
to return (an item)/to send back/to go back
to tear up/to rip up/too shred
